Reviews.Title: Kodak Z950
Reviews.Author: Happy SAHM of twin girls "Soraya"
Reviews.Content: I was going to buy the Kodak easyshare Z1015 IS (10 megapixels-15 optical zoom) because it has great reviews, more optical zoom and same price but after comparing the features and specifications of both, pretty much the Z950 has the same things but is not as big as the other one and it has more megapixels-12. It is also newer and looks great too. I took the risk, because I only found 1 review and it was 5stars. I bought it online and I received it on friday and I love the zoom it has and the picture quality. I agree with the thing commented before about the instructions it comes with, they are not so detail but the camara itself is easy to manage and use.Read my review, after one year of use...is below this one.

Reviews.Title: Excellent megazoom in a small package
Reviews.Author: J. Curtis
Reviews.Content: So far I have to say we (my wife and I) are impressed with the camera. The photos so far are relatively sharp (increasing the sharpness in P mode helps even more) and the colors are great. The ergonomics of the camera are well thought out and the build quality is solid.Having used small Kodak Cameras for the last few years (v550, v705 & m1033) this is a larger camera. That said, I think that the 10x Zoom will be a nice feature and make the size increase over the pocket cameras worth it.Shot to Shot performance is a bit on the sluggish side, but not too big of a deal. Shutter lag is very quick and is helpful for catching quick photos since we have a little baby that moves around a lot!It would have been nice to make the camera Dock compatible, but we can live with plugging it into the iMac with the USB to transfer photos and charge the battery.Overall I give it 4.5 out of 5 stars (not 5 stars due to the speed between photos and time to clear the buffer when shooting continuously).I would definitely recommend this camera!

Reviews.Title: Great little camera
Reviews.Author: Alice Hess "obplayer"
Reviews.Content: I needed an easy to use camera that takes sharp pictures and video. This camera fits the bill. With the 10X zoom, I took a picture of a lion at the zoo, and I can see his fur like I'm next to him. Video is just as clear. It is easy to upload the pictures to my computer using the supplied USB cord.  The price was excellent, too for a camera with all those features.

Reviews.Title: GREAT VIDEO:  must set to SINGLE FOCUS
Reviews.Author: Quang Tran "jijiquang"
Reviews.Content: The default Video setting is continuous focus which is REALLY bad because the camera keeps zooming in and out if your subject or lighting changes or moves. This is a common problem with a more advanced camera such as this Z950. Just change the auto focus to AF single focus and the camera will focus just fine (not at the nano second interval like before). Here is the Simple fix: move the dial to movie . hit the setting button (second down on the right side of the LCD screen) then select single focus from the AF menu.This camera is just amazing! VIDEO AND PICS are great!

Reviews.Title: Kodak Z950 Digital Camera (and HD video)
Reviews.Author: J. King
Reviews.Content: Pro'sBuy this camera if you have only $250 and want to have both great photo's and HD video with 12x OPTICAL ZOOM in video mode that fits in your pocket!Works well indoors in low light and great outdoors.Use the single focus setting with video to avoid continuous focus (going out of focus when scanning)Con'sThe included quick time software does not play video smoothly on my one year old lap top (The video card is not upgradeable) but I found a freeware download (Video Lan VLC media player)that plays it fine.The speaker in the camera has low volume so you have to put your ear on the speaker to hear the sound. The sound plays fine on the pc though.You'll need to order a separate battery charger that works independent of the camera operation and a separate video cable to playback the video to your HD TV ($25)

Reviews.Title: Great buy!!!
Reviews.Author: Noemi Garcia
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera after reading several reviews about it.  I can say that I am really satisfied with it. I had another Kodak that was five years old and it is still working.  I just wanted to buy another one that had a higher zoom and more mepapixels.  This camera has different picture modes that I don't know how to use like the pasm, but when you are switching between each one a message shows up in the screen giving a simple explanation of what that option is used for. I love the big screen, the video and picture quality is excellent.  I like that while I'm taking a video I can zoom in and zoom out.  Although while zooming the scene becomes a little blurred.  The optical zoom is 10X and you can see things very far away and the resolution is still great.  The battery lasts a long time.  I think that in two months I have charged it twice.  I would recommend this product to anybody looking to buy a camera.  One feature that I really like is that if you erase a video or photo by mistake you can recover it.  This only works for the last erased picture or photo, but believe me, it is great to have this feature.  The size of the camera is not as small as I would like it to be, but usually the smaller cameras in the market have less resolution and the zoom is not as good.

Reviews.Title: Excellent Color, quality at a reasonable price!
Reviews.Author: AMD "AMD"
Reviews.Content: We take a LOT of photos.  {6000 photos plus per year}  If you're looking for a easy to use, well made, excellent zoom, with the BEST color quality of any camera out there in this price range, you won't find a better camera. We tried the others,  {Cannon, Nikon, Minolta, etc.}, nothing comes close.  Highly recommend!

Reviews.Title: Kodak EasyShare Z950 digital camera review
Reviews.Author: Ms. Aileen D. Graeber
Reviews.Content: I have had a cannon digital camera for several years. It is slow to respond, picture quality was awful. Generally speaking, I was very disappointed with it.I purchased the Kodak EasyShare Z950 when I was sent an email from Kodak. I read other reviews of others who had already purchased and used it. So I took a chance.I have been very pleased with the results. It is quick to respond to multipule shutter clicks, which with 3 active grandchildren you need. The quality of the pictures that I printed out are fantastic. Even enlargements are crystal clear, perfect for what I needed.I am very pleased with this product and highly recommend it to anyone looking for a simple to use (right from the box!) great quality digital camera.

Reviews.Title: Great small point and shoot camera!
Reviews.Author: M. LeBlanc "Shelby L"
Reviews.Content: I wanted an easy to use camera that isn't too big and bulky.  This camera is perfect.  It takes very clear pictures, and I really like that it has a setting to take pictures of objects in motion.  I also love that it has a rechargable battery--my friends spend a fortune on AA batteries for their cameras.  I would definitely reccoment this product.

Reviews.Title: buyer beware
Reviews.Author: Cliff S "Cliff"
Reviews.Content: I chose a one star because it would have a chance of being read .  I normally do not do reviews.  This is a great camera for the money.  But there is one major problem with.  Which makes it almost worthless.  And if somebody else had left review on this I would have not bought the camera.  I like the camera so much, I am having trouble sending it back.  Here's the problem ,SPEED!!!!! the processor is too slow!!! if you shoot three pictures ,the fourth picture takes six to 30 seconds to process.. then every other picture takes six to 30 seconds to process... if you are shooting a misty day at high megapixel 12.. it is 30 or 40 seconds to process,,, if you shoot at six megapixel it does not change the situation is still too slow... I spent an hour  on the phone with the manufacturer tech .you will be hard-pressed to beat the bang for the buck on this camera..but remember you will not be able to take consecutive quick pictures pass the third one.

Reviews.Title: Amazing for the price
Reviews.Author: Who Said What? "Skeptic"
Reviews.Content: I was looking for a general purpose digital camera and of course the bewildering choices and prices were daunting. The image stabilization requirement helped filter my choices a little as I have some hand tremor. Personally I like Kodak cameras. I had a Kodak Z740 that I used for years totally happy. But the Z950 really is amazing considering the on-board features in addition to optical image stabilization: digital red eye removal, video trimming, cropping of stills, on board help, multiple selection of pictures, the list goes on and on. For the price, I don't know how Kodak does it. The lens and zoom range are great. The manual that comes with the camera is seriously weak but you can download the pdf version of the "extended" user manual which is very complete. Just study this manual to find and use all the features. Navigation through the various menus is easy and fairly thoughtfully designed to be user friendly despite the plethora of options. I also use the camera at school as I am a high school science teacher and the digital video clips are great for capturing scenes that can then be analyzed using Video Point software. The video trimming capability is really helpful for using the clips with Video Point. High definition video helps here too. The bang for this camera is not in its looks, which are fairly boring, but in what's inside. Amazing.

Reviews.Title: Very nice Camera
Reviews.Author: Thomas N TILLS "Tom"
Reviews.Content: I got this camera for a trip to NYC.  We have been using a Sony Mavica for the past 10 years or so and really like it, but it's slow, and large.So this camera was a joy. It boots up fast, takes great pictures, and is soooo easy to use.  My wife loves the auto mode.  I like to dabble in the specialty modes.  The kids love the panorama mode.  The Zoom is incredible.  We got some great shots from the top of the Empire State Bldg and 30 Roc.I was worried about running out of space on the cards, but we never filled more than 2 cards per day, snapping hundreds of pics per day.  I also got a spare battery, and only had to use it once.  It helps that I brought a laptop to load the pics on at the end of the day.Being from Rochester, NY,  I like having a Kodak, even if it is made in China.

Reviews.Title: My Awesome camera!!
Reviews.Author: Rebecca Estrada
Reviews.Content: About 8 years ago, a friend of mine suggested I buy a digital camera.  I went to walmart and bought a Kodak camera with docking station and printer.  This was my turning point.  Let me stress that I am NOT a professional photographer by any means, and have not gone to college for photography.  But the pictures I took turned out so well that I used it for eight years.  This year for christmas my husband decided to upgrade me.  I wanted another kodak but he convinced me to look at others just to make sure.  I looked at Sony, Fuji, and alot of others I won't care to mention but always kept coming back to Kodak.  I didn't want 16 mega pixel with only 8 gigs, or some of them were the other way around.  Customers reviews are a very useful tool for research, also because there was always something wrong with their product.  People who are more adept at taking pictures gave me more insight to the cameras and how they work and what I should look for.  After weeks of research and customer reviews, I finally convinced my husband to go with the Kodak Z950.  It has been the best money I have ever spent.  I am still learning about all of the bells and whistles and do a lot of deleting because I use the wrong settings, but after almost six months of use, I have to give Kudos to Kodak for this camera. It's easy to use, rechargeable batteries, and just the overall ease of use is just wonderful.

Reviews.Title: Great Camera
Reviews.Author: Michael L. Winans "Mike W."
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera because in the past I have always been pleased with Kodak cameras.  This camera has been the perfect upgrade for me.  MY old camera is about 4 years old and still takes good pictures but I want to see what I might be able to get in a smaller size so I purchased the Z950.  I love it!  Even with the smaller size the pictures are GREAT!  Quality always seems to be spot on and the auto focus mode that will change depending on the picture is perfect.  Zoom works wonderfully, 12 megapixel is plenty for me and allows for great editing on the computer.Video works great once you change the default focus mode from continuous to single.The pictures come out it prefect HD quality and the video is great.

Reviews.Title: Very Very good camera
Reviews.Author: Stanley A. Guerin
Reviews.Content: I've had many Kodak cameras, but this one is (by far) the best Kodak I've owned. My last 1 was a V1073, gave good pictures but was very hard to view outside. This one seems to be much better at that. Pictures are of the best type. Have not found anything about this camera that I can talk bad about. Price-great. pictures-great. If I had anything bad to say about it, that would have to be the owners manual (users guide). It isn't the best I've used, but I can work around that part of it. Believe me, this Z950 is well worth it's price and will give you all you are asking for.

Reviews.Title: Sharp pics, but my dog isn't green..
Reviews.Author: Phred
Reviews.Content: The Z950 is easy to use and takes pretty high resolution pictures, but the lens can't quite justify the full 12mpx - even with a tripod I can't see much difference between my 6 and 12 mpx test shots.  The low light performance is impressive for a point and shoot.  The battery life is excellent - over 100 pictures one day, including about 10 with flash, and the battery indicator still read full. I have a minor issue with the color resolution - I took some shots of my white lab out in the snow, and the shadows under his chin came out an odd green color.  You can only see it when you zoom way in, but this camera's color rendition program made that color up, for sure. My only other complaint is with the autofocus when taking video - not sure how to resolve this yet.  The camera searches for focus for too long, and even when the image is in focus and the subject distance is quite constant, it searches again and again, driving the focus out then re-finding it.  Obnoxious to view, but hey, this is a still, not a video camera.  Overall, I think it's a good camera for the money.

Reviews.Title: Kodak Z950 - Great picture quality
Reviews.Author: M. Greene
Reviews.Content: Before buying the Z950 I compared the picture quality to a few other cameras (some much more expensive).  I found the Kodak to give the best picture quality for novices.  Some other camera in the same class are geared more for serious photographers, who want something smaller than their SLR.  The Kodak is geared toward the novice, who wants better pictures than a mini-camera can provide.  The only drawback to this camera is that is is a little slow to turn on and there is a 2+ second pause between pictures.  While that is annoying - the picture quality makes up for it.

Reviews.Title: Everything I want in a point & shoot camera - and PASM too!
Reviews.Author: Yarii
Reviews.Content: I purchased a Kodak Z915 recently, then decided for slightly more money I could get HD video and 2 more mega pixels, so I went with this camera instead.  I'm glad I did - it's worth the extra money.  The difference between the Z915 and the Z950 is like night and day.  Kodak EasyShare Z915 Digital Camera (Black)This camera feels heftier, not cheap, thin plastic (it is still plastic - it also weighs just a little more than the Z915).  Although the battery compartment has a metal hinge and it springs open a little too fast, which after the first time opening it I learned to hold on when it swings open, it does feel a little cheap. I also like that the threaded tripod mount is made of metal on this camera.This camera uses a lithium ion battery instead of AA batteries.  The initial charge when I first unpacked the camera took slightly over 2 hours with the camera  plugged into a 110V outlet.  You can also charge it via the USB port on your computer but it will take MUCH longer this way.  I recommend buying a spare battery and plug-in charger, it will make your life easier when using this camera.Easy to use without reading the manual - and if you do need help, part of the manual is stored on-board - just press the button on the back of the camera.  It takes incredible pictures, even better than expensive Fuji and Panasonic cameras I previously owned.  You can include the date on the picture, something I had to add myself with software with any of my Fuji's.  I'm not sure about Nikon, but I think Canon is the only other camera manufacturer where you can include the date on the picture.The shutter lag time is super fast.  I rarely miss a shot while waiting on the shutter to respond.  It's incredibly fast when using no flash, and still what seems to be under a second when using the flash.**NOTE:  Make sure you buy an SDHC memory card with a MINIMUM Class 6 rating for the fastest photo capturing. Too bad I can't make this bold, I cannot stress enough you will be unhappy with processing time between shots with a Class 2 or Class 4 SD card!****NOTE: QuickView is Kodak's name for their reviewing function.  Immediately after you take a picture, you see it displayed on the LCD screen for 5 seconds.  That's a long time to wait before your next shot, but if you lightly press the shutter button, the review picture goes away and you can take the next shot.  You can also turn this off completely, but then you can't quickly review what you have just taken.**There are also very few cameras in this price range where you can have full manual control should you want to - you can set your own focus, aperture, shutter speed, flash compensation and ISO.PROS:Large 3" LCD screen, I can see it in the sun tooGood build quality, even though it's plastic, it's sturdyRight side of camera has a large rubber grip, so it won't slip from your handFull manual settings (PASM), hard to find in a camera this priceA wonderful 10X optical zoom from a great manufacturer of lenses, I previously owned a camera with a Leica lens and this Schneider-Kreuznach lens is just as goodHD videosOne year warranty (for the USA)CONS:Flimsy battery compartment doorI don't like the software that came with it, I prefer PicasaDefinitely a 5 star camera.

Reviews.Title: HUGE bang for your buck!!
Reviews.Author: R. Kramer "SV Rider"
Reviews.Content: UPDATE 10/19/2010 Have owned this camera for 7 months now and have taken probably thousands of pictures (many work related). I can honestly say that this was an awesome purchase for me.Original Review:So far very impressed!!  To be able to get a package that does so much for less than $200....amazing!First the minor complaints.  The charging plug is huge.  I really like the Canon style that has the AC prongs that fold flat...much easier to travel with.  I bought mine as a package so it came with the USB cable.  It did not come with AV outputs which I think it should have...again, that is standard with Canon's.  If you would like to turn on the camera just to preview pictures it automatically extends the lens.  Would be nice to have a setting for review only without having to open and extend lens.  These are minor annoyances though.Very impressed with picture quality.  I am not a professional photographer so I will miss things the pros wont, but in my eyes the picture quality is excellent.  The image stabilization even at full zoom is great!  Indoor shots with the flash are quite good...not overly washed out when shooting close up.  My Canon pics would come out almost white when shooting a close up flash, so I was very pleased to be able to take close ups with a flash.Another very nice feature is the zoom is adjustable when taking video!  I could not find another ultra zoom point and shoot that did this, at least in this price range.  I took some video of a friend waterskiing and it came out very good, at least on my computer.  Haven't been able to test on a HD TV, but on a computer no complaints.  If you do zoom in and out while shooting video it takes a bit to focus, but this is not a dedicated video cam.On camera editing is another nice feature, from full cropping to touch up.  Stitching panorama shots is very easy and the output is fantastic.Have had the camera a few weeks and taken quite a few indoor shots with flash and I have not had to recharge yet.  Many other cameras have complaints of short battery life...this one ranks high.Finally, it feels good in the hands with a nice rubberized grip.  I really liked my old Canon Powershot, mostly due to it's tiny size, but the lack of zoom and poor indoor flash shots make this Kodak the camera I will reach for.This is my first Kodak digital camera and if it holds up like I think it will, it won't be my last!

Reviews.Title: This is one fantastic camera
Reviews.Author: Ben Thompson
Reviews.Content: The zoom on this camera is fantastic for the size of the body, it still fits in your pocket, but expands out for a full 10x optical zoom.  Also, the optical image stabilization is far than the cheap digital version found on many similar-priced cameras.  The HD video is fantastic, and as is the story with all Kodaks the picture quality is incredible, and the colors are true to life and never subdued.  The camera has quite a few manual adjustments if you want complete control over the photos, but also works great in auto modes as well.There is no optical viewfinder - but the LCD is 3" and more than adequate.  Also, the batttery is proprietary if this matters to you - but a generic backup can be found on Amazon for $6.

Reviews.Title: Love this camera
Reviews.Author: Nancy A.
Reviews.Content: I love Kodak Easy Share Cameras. This is my 5th one. I gave two of them to my children who also love them. I love getting the newest models. I have not found a point and shoot that I like better and I have tried several other brand name cameras.

Reviews.Title: Great camera that produce nice pictures when you set the right features for the right scenario.
Reviews.Author: M. Paris "Mepp"
Reviews.Content: This camera is very quick and when performance, quality and affordable price are required the Z950 does the job.Just think: HD pictures & videos, 12mp, 10x optical zoom, 3 inch screen, Kodak quality, etc all in one camera for a reasonable price.I highly recommend the Z950.

Reviews.Title: Kodak Z950
Reviews.Author: Richard C. Benton "Hiker"
Reviews.Content: I believe this to be the best digital camera for the price. It is a very good point and shoot but can be set for aperture or shutter speed. The quality of the picture is outstanding. Even when zoomed in the image stabilization keeps the picture from blurring. The color quality is also excellent,the picture and the scene match perfectly. I bought one for my wife at Christmas and liked it so much I replaced my 18month old KodakZ875 with a new Z950. Kodak improved that much over a year.Kodak EasyShare Z950 Digital Camera

Reviews.Title: Great Little Camera!
Reviews.Author: K. Richmond
Reviews.Content: I'm not a huge Kodak fan, but after purchasing a Kodak printer and now a camera...I've changed my tune.  This camera is perfect if you just need a camera for those occasions that are on the move, like birthday parties, kid's playing @ the park, or a sports activity.  The quality of picture is good, but I'm biased because my other camera is a Sony Alpha, so I have pretty high standards.  Perfect to carry around in a purse or diaper bag for those times when you needed the "in case" camera.  Rechargeable battery is great- saves a bundle on purchasing AA's.

Reviews.Title: Amazing Picture Quality
Reviews.Author: Photog 73 "GO EAGLES!!!!"
Reviews.Content: As a semi-professional photographer, I bought this initially as an inexpensive lark. Forgot the brand or the price I just compared it against my digital SLR and looked. Practically fell out of my chair.Colors are rich (maybe not 100% accurate but colors that pop and are deeply saturated), metering is unbelievable accurate (this little camera seems to avoid blowing out highlights that plague every little point and shoot I have tried up to now), pictures are pin sharp. Overall, this camera takes pictures that shocked me. Beautiful, sharp,  bright contrasty pictures.Ergonomics are excellent. The camera just fits nicely and solid in my hands, yet still small.Lens, for a point and shoot, is reasonably fast lens (fast lens refers basically to how efficiently the lens uses incoming light). Compare it to the megazooms from the major manufacter that starts with a C or a P.That being said, it is not perfect.-Build quality is below average, the body creaks if you hold it too tight.-Processing of images after you take a picture AND when switching between modes (Program to Manual, Shutter Priority) is very sluggish. Nothings happens fast with this camera.-Charging of battery in camera body is a clear cut cost savings method. Pain if you have multiple batteries.Overall-This is an AMAZING little camera, regardless of the price; at this price I think it is a STEAL. If your buying a camera for superb pictures, this is the one. If you are a equipment nerd looking to impress your buddies with the latest, greatest high end prosumer point and shoot, this ain' t it.Forgot the price; this is just an unbelievable camera for taking near SLR grade pictures. Build quality is below average, but something has to give for this price.

Reviews.Title: Great Camera, but difficult to figure out
Reviews.Author: R Stevens
Reviews.Content: 2013 Update:  This camera's picture taking quality has degraded.  I have to find another brand.  No more Kodaks.__________________________I just bought this camera yesterday.  At first I thought I was going to return it until I finally figured out (sort of) how to work the camera.  I am a point and shooter so trying to set up the settings was difficult at first.  I am still working with it, but I found that I had to take my time and take photos a session at a time on various settings and in varying lights (set up a small studio in my closet with poster board and 2 gooseneck lamps). This camera can take some really nice close up shots.  I would have given it 5 stars, but the manual really doesn't have much to go on, which meant I had to work too hard to figure the camera out.  I am happy with it though.

Reviews.Title: Good features for the price but overexposed & yellowish images in Auto mode
Reviews.Author: M. Stone
Reviews.Content: (Edited Jan. 15, 2011 after further use.) I had always overlooked Kodak cameras when testing cameras in stores, mostly because I didn't think I'd like the design of their control buttons on the back.  But after reading some reviews and hearing a friend say how much his sister loved her Kodak, I wanted to try this one.  I don't understand why I've never seen this particular model on display in any store I've been to.  Or why it was not reviewed in the most recent issue of Consumer Reports magazine that had digital camera reviews in it.  Kodak needs to try harder to get their products out in the public eye more.Anyway, so far this camera takes good sharp photos.  It has a lot of controls and features to choose from.  Once I got used to the display, buttons, and menu, they are not that bad.  The only thing I don't like is the little black joystick thing that you use to move your menu selection up and down, then press it to select.  Sometimes if you don't press it exactly in the middle, it will move your menu selection back up or down, instead of selecting.  But you get used to it.I compared photos from a Sony DSC-H20 and a Canon SD1200 that I already have.  The Sony model is in a similar class to this Kodak.  Overall I think the Kodak had sharper images with less noise.  It did really well with outdoor daylight photos, even all the way out at 10X zoom.  The only issue I had was in lower light settings in AUTO mode - some images were slightly over-exposed and some had *slightly* inaccurate color.I took photos of bright & colorful plastic kid's toys in a low light setting in AUTO mode with all 3 of my cameras.  The Canon had the  most accurate color, the Kodak was the sharpest, while the Sony had mostly accurate color but a LOT of noise.  The Kodak looked slightly brighter with a very slight yellowish or greenish tint to the toys, but the weird thing was that when I tried to adjust the levels in Photoshop, the software said the levels were fine.  So I tried adjusting the color saturation and hues, but never could get the color to look as accurate as the Canon images.  Strange.  But one thing that helped was taking pics in Program mode, keeping the color on Natural Color, but lowering the exposure settings a little.The AUTO mode seems to be okay for daylight or normal shooting conditions. You will probably have to tinker with the settings & take photos in Program or Manual if the conditions are less than ideal. I've consistently found indoor & people photos in Auto mode to be somewhat overexposed & yellowish. I can't seem to adjust the color to make it look right, even in Photoshop. There must be something in the Kodak processor that is doing weird things with the color, kind of like how my Canon always makes reds look too pink, or deep purples too blue.Video mode on this Kodak is not that great. It was kind of grainy, even in bright light. Some people mentioned you need to change the focus setting from "continuous" to "single" in order to avoid the "jello" effect when zooming.  I tried that, but it did not seem to help.  I would rate video on this camera as just okay, it probably would be fine for everyday family settings, or maybe daylight outdoor videos, etc.  But I'm definitely keeping my Sony for shooting videos at concerts; that camera has some awesome sound quality for concerts!Somebody below mentioned you have to use Kodak's software to upload images to your computer - not true.  You can plug it up to your computer with the USB cord and the computer will pick it up like an extra drive, so you can just drag & drop photos to wherever you want them.  If you don't want to use the Kodak software, you don't need to install it.IMPORTANT:  I like that this Kodak gives you the option to take photos in the 3:2 aspect ratio (at the 10 MP size), which is what you need to have prints made if you don't want your photos cropped on the top & bottom edges when prints are made.  This should really be the default aspect ratio for ALL digital cameras, because most people are going to want at least SOME prints made, and I don't know why all the camera manufacturers have moved to the default 4:3 size.  That is fine for the background image on a 4:3 computer monitor, if that's the only place you plan to put your images, but it's stupid for printed photographs.  My current Sony gives the 3:2 option also, but I've noticed that most of the new Sony cameras don't, which is a shame.Some reviewers complain about the slow time to process a photo.  This is probably just the review setting where the image shows up for 5 seconds.  You can turn this off, and if you need to review the image you just took, just hit the little "play" button at the bottom of the camera and you can see it pretty quickly.  Either that, or you may need to get at least a Class 4 SD card.Pros:*  Manual control and many features plus 10X zoom at a good price*  Clear sharp photos, easy to use, fairly quick response time*  Gives you the option for 3:2 aspect ratio, which is great for prints*  Good size and controls, easy to grip with the soft gray hand grip on front and thumb grip on backCons:*  Auto mode not quite as good under low light conditions, need to use P or M*  Videos mostly just mediocre quality, esp. under low light*  Would be nice if Kodak would make it in a cool color or something, maybe this would draw more people's attention.  It's shallow I know, but these days people mostly seem to be attracted to the cameras that look cool, regardless of their picture quality!

Reviews.Title: Great camera
Reviews.Author: Philip "Vin"
Reviews.Content: if you are looking for a simple to use camera that takes a great picture look no further.  Love the zoom on it and the different modes video in 720 p seems to be ok.  I picked this camera cause of Cnets positive reviews and it was the right price range.

Reviews.Title: KODAK Z 950
Reviews.Author: Geoffrey A. Fletcher
Reviews.Content: VERY AWESOME CAMERA.  DOCUMENTATION LEAVES SOMETHING TO BE DESIRED, BUT THE ONLINE CHAT ROOM SHOULD GIVE ADEQUATE ANSWERS.  ONCE YOU GET HELP FROM THE CHAT ROOM, YOUR PRODUCTIVITY SHOULD BE ASSURED.  THE HD VIDEO FEATURE IS GREAT (UP TO 29 MINUTES, WITH SOUND ON A FULL BATTERY AND EMPTY 8 GIG MEMORY CARD).  THE RESPONSE (ELAPSED) TIME FROM PUSHING THE SHUTTER BUTTON TO ACTUAL PICTURE TAKING FOR STILL SHOTS (ESPECIALLY IN CONTINUOUS FOCUS MODE) IS REALLY SHORT, VERY QUICK, AND VERY EFFECTIVE.  PHOTO QUALITY EVEN AT MAX TELEPHOTO IS EXCELLENT.  IS NO BIGGER THAN YESTERYEAR'S "POINT AND SHOOT" CAMERAS.  VERY HIGHLY RATED BY CONSUMER REPORTS IN ITS "SUPER TELEPHOTO" POINT AND SHOOT CATEGORY.  COST WAS ABOUT 35% CHEAPER THAN LOCAL RETAIL MERCHANTS, AND STILL BEAT THE BIG BOX DISCOUNT HOUSES HANDS DOWN.

Reviews.Title: Great for staged/artistic photography, bad for everyday/"facebook" photos
Reviews.Author: Alexander Gruber "AG"
Reviews.Content: Summary:| PROS:|  - Manual control of shutter speed, aperture, etc. is amazing for amateur photographers.|  - Great optical/digital zoom and megapixels for price range.|| CONS:|  - Image stabilization degrades with age.|  - After several pictures, each picture is followed by 20-30 seconds of "processing."My biggest complaint with this camera is that after owning it for several years, pictures taken on my Z950 turn out blurry about 70% of the time.  It's not a good camera to take with you to the bar.  'Spontaneous' pictures taken without holding the camera perfectly still will not look good.On the other hand, staged/artistic photography comes out fantastic if you take the time to play with the manual settings and fine tune the aperture and shutter speed.

Reviews.Title: Kodak EasyShare z950
Reviews.Author: photoenthusiest
Reviews.Content: I bought the Z950 a little over a year ago.  It has been a good travel camera but there are some things I did not like about the camera.Pros:  Easy travel; 12 mp 10x optical zoom; light weight; 3" LCD that could be adjusted or darkened in bright daylight;CONS:  Lens scratches easily; too many shadows; can't zoom all the way without blurriness; When you take a picture of the moon, it does not capture the detail, the image becomes a white blob with a halo around it; close-up (tele-photo)images of nature scenes are blurry and washed out; Battery does not last as long as I would have liked and would recommend purchase of extra battery to have on hand.  Can't take pictures while camera is plugged into the outlet as I was able to do with a previous Fugji FinePix camera; Shooting performance can be frustrating; comparatively narrow lensBecause the lens was scratched and having accidental warranty on this item I am able to return the camera to receive a full refund.  I will be staying with Kodak going to the Z990 model.

Reviews.Title: Excellent camera for its price
Reviews.Author: gyimesimate
Reviews.Content: This camera means the end of our long trip finding a good camera in this price range. We owned an older Kodak Z650, which was stolen from us. Then we tried a Fuji camera but soon turned back to Kodak with the z981. However, it was a complete nightmare!!! We than sold it quickly and fortunately did not left Kodak. A sales agent from Kodak recommended the z950, which is far better than the 981 (while it's much cheaper!!). The picture quality is excellent, the features are maximally satisfy our needs and it is very easy to use and travel with. I DO SUGGEST EVERYONE TO BUY THIS NICE CAMERA!

Reviews.Title: Easy to use with AWESOME results!
Reviews.Author: krlski
Reviews.Content: One of the greatest things we like about this camera is that the shutter corresponds very closely to when you press the button.  No more missing photos because you press the button and the camera takes a second and a half to open the shutter.  The picture quality is really amazing considering its ease of use.  I went around the yard with my expensive Nikon (5X the cost of this Kodak) and had my 7 year old son shoot the same shots I was taking.  I'm honestly not sure if any of the Nikon shots were any better.  Just a great camera!

Reviews.Title: Very good, compact camera
Reviews.Author: Arthur C. Schlicht
Reviews.Content: This is a very good camera for an amature photographer.  Pictures were quite clear, and the 10X zoom works well, with very handy operational trigger.  Well worth the money!

Reviews.Title: Nice camera if you are not in a hurry
Reviews.Author: Doc Goodbyte "Doc"
Reviews.Content: This camera is just about perfect for me. The only flaw is the time between photos. It is far slower than any of my other cameras. So it you are not snapping consecutive shots, this the camera for you. If you like quick repetitive photos then look elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: Camera
Reviews.Author: Donna J. Hallock
Reviews.Content: Though the camera is heavy,despite its size, I have been impressed with the pictures I have taken. I would recommend it highly.

Reviews.Title: Great purchase
Reviews.Author: Lynnette M. Johnson
Reviews.Content: I love this camera for the size, easy to use and the pictures are so crips and clear.  Great purchase, this is my 3rd Kodak camera and this is my favorite.

Reviews.Title: easy to use
Reviews.Author: Terry D. Predmore
Reviews.Content: easy to use, takes great pictures, does not come with sd card, consider that when you are compairing price's, some sellers include the sd card! In hind sight I would have rather bought a Kodak package ie sd card, carrying pouch etc.

Reviews.Title: READ BEFORE BUYING
Reviews.Author: GHBAEB
Reviews.Content: We have had a kodak Z612 for years - took thousands of pictures. For the price couldn't pass this one up! BUT BUT BUT the battery can be fully charged - and after a few days take a few pictures and BAMO it's dead! Also ... SPEED - the other review is dead on... I've never used a camera that had such a lag on it before! We have a high speed memory card - didn't help. IF it's for casual use then it appears to be a great camera. If it's not - it'd be better to shop for something else. It literally is 2 -3 pictures - then like the other review said.... 10-15 seconds until you can take another....

Reviews.Title: Z950 review
Reviews.Author: Don A. Ross, Sr.
Reviews.Content: The Kodak EAshShare Z950 camera is replacing my DX7630 camera which was damaged during my last sight seeing tour.  The Z950 is more compact, better features and a most satisfactory replacement!!

Reviews.Title: Exactly what I wanted and expected
Reviews.Author: Cynthia Cox
Reviews.Content: I already have a camera just like it which has been used often for at least 3 years.  Since the camera is no longer being made, I wanted to replace mine with an identical one.  The pictures are excellent and I know the camera; thus, I don't have to learn to operate a new one. CAC

Reviews.Title: Kodak EasyShare
Reviews.Author: Mother of two
Reviews.Content: I owned this camera previously and it became damaged. I truely enjoyed it and it was easy to use. I enjoyed it so much that when the one I had was damaged the only choice I could see was to buy another. I am very pleased with this product and would purchase it again if the need for another arose.

Reviews.Title: AMAZING!
Reviews.Author: Alucard "xNosferatux"
Reviews.Content: I like to take pictures. I'm no professional photographer, but I took a mini course during a summer camp in high school. So, every time I get a chance at a camera, I like to take pictures with all sorts of angles and focus. This camera is amazing! With my own experience and being able to customize how the pictures will look, they end up looking amazing. It has the option of "smart mode" in which it automatically makes all the changes necessary to make the picture look amazing. All you have to do(what I recommend) is get a good angle and focus on what you want to focus on. It also has the option to make it more than a point and shoot camera. You can change the settings. It has many settings, but they aren't too overwhelming for someone to decipher. Overall, I love it, and the price on Amazon was amazing. At my local store, it would have cost a couple hundred dollars more.

Reviews.Title: Good cam... if u got patience
Reviews.Author: StephanieD
Reviews.Content: When I cut it on, it takes at least a whole minute before I can finally take a picture. I hate waiting & I have no patience! If something is happening RIGHT THEN- I wana be able to take the pic RIGHT THEN! But by the time I can take a picture, my chance is GONE! I have 3 kids & NO child wants to have 2 sit there & hold their smile 4 forever... Im DEF gona invest in a better (Kodak) cam...

Reviews.Title: Worked well for 13 months, then broke frustratingly
Reviews.Author: M. Livshutz
Reviews.Content: I bought Z950 in September, 2010. It worked for a year fine. Now it can no longer focus at all.It starts up with normal focus. I can zoom in and out and it stays in focus.Regrettably, as soon as I press the usual 'big button' halfway to focus, it instead blurs for as long as the camera stays on.Pictures and video become blurred. The blurring gets worse as I try to take more pictures.Blurring occurs in all modes, including video.The 'AF' sign turns  red, which I haven't seen before. Perhaps the firmware understands there's a problem.I also hear some quiet repeating mechanical noise.It wasn't occurring when the blurring started two days ago, but started to occur today.There is one situation in which auto-focus works correctly - when the camera is zoomed in all the way (10X).As soon as it is zoomed out even a bit, auto-focus goes back to being blurred and 'AF' turns red.When it is zoomed in again, auto-focus starts working again and pictures look good again.We had this camera slightly over a year and I made a point of getting it because we wanted to support an American company.It was a good camera with good zoom at a good price. Of course video quality was grainy, as also mentioned in other reviews, but not too bad.Now I feel that the quality of our own American product needs to be better. Our old cheap Canon lasted four years just fine.

Reviews.Title: Top-notch point-and-shoot digital
Reviews.Author: MdniteEagl
Reviews.Content: I've had the Kodak Z950 for three months now.  It replaced the Kodak Z730 purchased in 2005 (although I still have the older camera), and is better in every way except one.  The Z950 offers a better variety of picture sizes, can shoot 720p HD video, and has an excellent zoom range - both optical and digital.  I like the size and weight of the camera, although the Z730 felt a little better in the hand from the more contoured body.  This camera does not have a traditional viewfinder, so if that's what you prefer over the LCD screen, this camera is not for you.The user's manual PDF isn't as detailed as it could be, and a couple of features had to be figured out on my own.  For example, the self-timer button on the camera is also the burst control, but you have to continue pressing the button before you get to the icons that the manual mentions.The only drawback I've come across?  Battery life isn't as good as the Z730, and the recharge time is longer whether I use in-camera charging or remove the battery and use the standalone charger.Otherwise, I'm very pleased with the camera and its performance.  No reason why it shouldn't last the 5+ years of front-line service as the Z730.

Reviews.Title: Good Camera for the Price
Reviews.Author: SirStinky
Reviews.Content: I did a lot of research before I bought this camera. I was looking for a digital camera and looked at the Lumix DMC-TZ5k, ZS3, Canon PowerShot SX130is, SX200is, and SD4500, Sony CyberShot HX5V, and Nikon CoolPix S8100 in the price range of $150-250. It was a showdown between the Lumix ZS3, Sony HX5V and the Kodak Easyshare Z950. The Sony was the stand-out, but the Kodak won because the price was right. The Z950 has a 12.1 MP sensor, 10x optical zoom Schneider Kreuznach lens, image stabilization, and a set of full manual controls (P,A,S,M) plus scene modes and it shoots 720 HD video.The camera body is mostly plastic and just feels cheap, but it does have good heft to it. There's a rubberized texture on the right side under the shutter release front and back to help grip when shooting one handed, a nice feature. It's classified as a compact megazoom, but it's not all that compact. You'd be hard-pressed to fit it into a pant pocket. It's a little smaller than the Canon Powershot SX130is but bigger than the Panasonic Lumix TZ5 or ZS3.Handling and ergonomics are pretty good. The buttons are easy to press and the controls are well laid-out easy to find. There's a lighted marker for the mode selector and the flash control and timer buttons are illuminated, which I really like. You'll also get a HD badge to the left of the mode dial that glows red when you turn the camera on, which is a little gimmicky to me. There's a joystick on back for navigating menu controls which was easy to manipulate, and there are 4 hard keys along the right edge of the display for delete, quick menu, image information, and image view. The speaker is located above the joystick. The menu is well laid-out and the interface is easy to use and works well. I was able to access functions quickly and easily.When I turned the camera on I was greeted by a 12-13 second delay while it read the memory card, which is bad in case you want to take a picture right away (Kodak moments). Shooting performance is slow. I took 4 quick shots and was greeted by a 3 second delay while it did some processing. I was also dissapointed with the display. It's a 3 inch widescreen LCD with 230K dpi, which doesn't do the pictures this camera takes justice. I would have liked to see a 460 dpi screen like on the Panasonic, which really helps show the details in the picture you took, especially good for finding blurring.The pictures this camera takes are hit-and-miss. I got some really good ones but some not-so-good ones. The high point of this camera is the full manual controls and high quality optics. I can't think of any other point-and-shoot compact megazoom camera that offers as many manual controls as this one. The Lumix ZS3,7, PowerShot SX130is, SX200is or SD4500 have them, but not like the Kodak. You can help the camera take good pictures in difficult shooting conditions by adjusting the various parameters (aperture, shutter speed, exposure compensation). On automatic mode the camera tended to overexpose photos, but otherwise it's pretty "intelligent." You get 17 preset sceen modes, a panorama, and sport modes. The panorama mode is a little finicky. It requires a steady hand to stitch the images together and there is a learning curve. Something I didn't have to do with the Panasonic Lumix.The flash is powerful and offers good range. Low-light photos without the flash are pretty good, but not great. You can fit that by switching to the shutter priority (S on the mode dial) and selecting a slower shutter speed, or the A setting and a larger apature. I almost think that the camera's image processor has trouble keeping up with the lens! I know the Schneider Variogon (think Leica, Zeiss, Swarovski) is capable of very good image transmission, but the camera can't make the most of its performance.You can also use a scene mode for night. Beware to keep the camera as still as possible though. It's almost mandatory to use a tripod to keep them from blurring. The image stabilizer works pretty good. However, the sport mode did little to prevent blurring fast-moving subjects in room lighting. Noise control is good enough, a little above average to me. There was some noticable noise at ISO's above 200 but not enough to take away from the picture quality. Anything above ISO 400 though and it gets intrusive as the camera tries to compensate by adding sharpening. The flash works good as well, but it does tend to turn the images a little blue in some cases, which was odd to me.The battery life is pretty good, average to me. I let it sit for 3 days without using it, and when I did use it I only got 100 pictures before it died. Kodak claims it can do 280-300, but in the real-world figure 250 at most. For durability, I'd be careful with it. It's mostly made of plastic. Only the lens and lens housing are aluminum, unlike my Panasonic, the Sony, and Canon which has aluminum-clad bodies. Drops will certainly cause damage. Plastic cracks easily unlike metal which dents. Be careful with it! Plus the battery door is made of thin flimsy plastic that seems like it would break off if you were too physical with it.The video is pretty good. You get three modes with 720P on top. The sounds were loud and you can zoom while recording. The zoom lens motors are quiet, but you can hear them. There is some very annoying focus-hunting while recording, especially at distant subjects using the zoom, but you can fix that by leaving it regular auto focus (not constant focus). The other complaint is the video format. It's a Quicktime format which I do not like much. AVI or MPEG would have been much better for compatibility. It doesn't work well with my computers, and sometimes the camera doesn't recognize it when I try to view it on the camera display.I have a 16GB card and I can shoot 30 min. of video in HD or store over 4,000 12MP pictures.So, that's the Z950. It's a great, no-frills, utilitarian camera that does a lot very well, despite being about $200. It's competitors also do a lot, some of them do it better. There are other really good cameras out there with similar features, but plan on spending $50-150 more for them. You can tell that Kodak did some cost-cutting in the feature set, but despite that it takes good pictures, has full manual controls, lots of desirable and essential features, a very nice lens, good ergonomics, and the price is right. Sure the display could be better resolution, the shooting performance could use improvement, the video could be better, and the photo quality is hit or miss, but if you're looking for a new 10x compact camera, look at Kodak first.Pros:Affordable12 MPFully adjustible manual controls3" displayHigh quality opticsGood image qualityLighted controls for the flash, dial position marker, and timerLots of shooting scene modesCons:Poor shooting performanceImage quality can be hit-or-missVideo quality could be betterVideo formats in Quicktime onlyA little bulkyQuestionable durability

Reviews.Title: positive feedback
Reviews.Author: grammymoody
Reviews.Content: I purchased this camera for an Alaska cruise.  It did a very good job.  Other higher priced cameras do a better job, but for the money this was a great buy.

Reviews.Title: Kodak stands behind their cameras
Reviews.Author: Alex Weibel
Reviews.Content: Very pleased with the Z950 for the price. LCD screen was defective, but Kodak repaired it under warranty. Seems OK so far. Pictures are on a par with the Z915. 12 megapixels gives a little more flexibility than 10. Only complaint is very slow to save to the SD card. The HD video is an improvement over the Z915.Kodak EasyShare Z915 10MP Digital Camera with 10x Optical Image Stabilized Zoom and 2.5 inch LCD Black Kit (includes Battery, Charger and Bag)

Reviews.Title: Very Nice Camera
Reviews.Author: Elizabeth
Reviews.Content: I purchased this camera to replace one that I had for years. This one is so much more user friendly and self explanatory, I was amazed. I'm not real camera savvy, kind of a point and shoot type person, and this has worked perfectly. We were leaving on vacation four days after I ordered it and I was not sure I would receive it before we had to leave, but it came right on schedule, so I was able to take some great pictures of our vacation. I am very happy with my purchase and I would recommend this camera if you want simplicity and great pictures. Plus with the rechargeable battery, I don't have to worry about having extra batteries on hand.

Reviews.Title: Awesome Camera at Great Price!
Reviews.Author: Nancy from Western New York
Reviews.Content: I wanted a camera that was smaller than the one I already own and this one had all thefeatures I was looking for...zoom, lots of megapixels, rechargable battery and easy to useand it's a Kodak! Great price and I am very happy with it.

Reviews.Title: My easy share
Reviews.Author: W.D
Reviews.Content: Great picture and video for a point and shoot.If you can't be bothered with all the fancy settings you just want to take a picture with good quality this is your starter camera nice features good video but low sound playback through camera speaker.

Reviews.Title: Incredible camera!
Reviews.Author: Felicia
Reviews.Content: I have never had a digital camera.  With a trip to Europe coming, I started researching cameras to find a high MP and high zoom but didn't want to spend much more than $100.  Although this camera had 12MP instead of 14MP, I decided to try it because the price was in my range and I felt comfortable with the Kodak name.  I purchased a high speed 8MB internal card because I read that the recovery time between shots was slow for some users, as well as a spare battery...just in case.  I made a point to read some of the usage instructions before I left on the trip because other purchasers commented that the manual is a PDF file online instead of printed and included with the camera.When the camera arrived, I took a few test pictures and was floored.  The SD card was recognized instantly - no problems there.  The recovery time between photos was a couple of seconds but I figured out that I could lightly press the shutter button to prepare for the next shot immediately, or disable the display feature that shows the photo just taken on the view screen.  The photos picked up incredible detail that I hadn't noticed taking the picture, like a single dog hair stuck to the dog's nose.  The color and clarity were great.Once in Europe, the first real test was careening through Barcelona on the top of a double-deck tourist bus.  It actually became comical - I would just point in the general direction of the targeted building or landscape and push the button to get a phenomenal photo, no matter how fast the bus was whipping around turns or flying down a street.  When the bus paused to pick up more passengers, I played with the zoom features to grab detail on a gargoyle or rooftop garden.  My photos blew away a travel companion's from an older Sony.  All of outdoor shots were in daytime, natural light, landscape setting.Inside buildings like St. Peter's Basilica in Rome, the photos were a little more challenging but still very impressive.  Without flash (as required in some locations) and on the portrait setting, the photos were acceptable but flash/portrait were very good.  On the cruise ship, I captured some of the best photographs of people with sunsets in the background any of them have ever taken, as well as crisp, clean shots at dinner.I also used the panorama feature and was actually shocked to discover how easily and how well it worked.  It was a feature I hadn't read about so I had to figure it out on the fly.  Panorama was fantastic for ports with bays or inlets that were surrounded by beautiful scenery all the way around.Despite taking several hundred photographs, I never had to use the spare battery purchased on clearance at the local Target store.  I just charged the battery overnight each night and had no issues.  Thanks to the 8MB high-speed card, recovery time between shots was not an issue, though I did not try any photographs where the subject (and not the photographer) was moving.  I haven't printed any of the photos yet but online and zoomed/cropped, the photos surpass my expectations.Downsides:  The camera is definitely not a size that can be slipped in a pocket or small purse for carrying, and it is a bit heavier than some might like.  So far, this is the only complaint about the camera and not really a complaint because I prefer a bit sturdier feel to the camera.  It fits my hand well when shooting pictures and it is easy to *not* forget somewhere because it is larger.All in all, I am thrilled with the purchase, especially because I thought I would have to spend a lot more to obtain all the features I wanted.

Reviews.Title: Maria
Reviews.Author: momma maria
Reviews.Content: I had the EasyShare c875, and was very happy with it and decided to upgrade to the higher zoom of the Z950 after reading other customer reviews here on Amazon. I was pleased with the control for the zoom and the increased video quality. Also the seperate power button and rechargeable lithium ion battery. Definitely recommend for the quality for the price.

Reviews.Title: Good For The Money
Reviews.Author: B. Castro "spaced boy"
Reviews.Content: If you want it for multiple rapid fire photography, DO NOT BUY IT. If you are getting it for everyday photography, BUY IT. Very good camera for everyday use. Amazing price for a really good camera full of great features, easy to use, simple and straight forward. I would have given it 5 stars, except the speed issue and short battery life. get an extra battery, you will need it. Zoom is great! Good lens. For this price, it is worth trying out.

Reviews.Title: GREAT ONE  CAMERA
Reviews.Author: E. Connolly "summer"
Reviews.Content: IT IS A GOOD CAMERA .IT TAKES GOOD PICTURES. I HAVE NO PROBLINGS WITH IT THANK YOU

Reviews.Title: Works for me.
Reviews.Author: Otis
Reviews.Content: Have not had the camera long enough to learn all the features, but I'm still well pleased.  I used the Program setting for most pictures so far.  Picture quality is great and the zoom is impressive.  Shot my nephew and his friends at from over 100 yards and the picture was so clear there was no problem picking out who was who.  At high MP's it does take a second or two to process, but I didn't buy the camera to take modeling pictures.  When I finally learn to set the camera for different conditions I'm sure I'll be even happier.  And you can't beat $117.

Reviews.Title: Great zoom and picture; poor processing speed - but GREAT for the price and ease
Reviews.Author: Cheryl Mcdonough "Goddess Is A Verb"
Reviews.Content: Great zoom and picture; poor processing speed - but GREAT for the price and ease of usability.  I read the Amazon reviews before I bought this camera and was disheartened by the consistent complaint of the processing speed.  While I did find it to be true, it is still a great camera, especially with the 10x zoom and megapixel.  I've always had Kodaks and find them easy to use.  The suggested work-around for the poor processing speed was to get a class 4 high speed memory card, which I did, and did not notice an improvement.  I like the camera so much I will just accept this limitation.  It takes a great picture and so easy to use!!!Through Amazon I bought this from Best Value (or something like that) and they were great.  Shipped on time, no problems.  I figure if they're on Amazon they have to be reputable.

Reviews.Title: A GREAT Point and Shoot Camera
Reviews.Author: E. V. Olsen Jr.
Reviews.Content: I have had a variety of point and shoot digital cameras for a number of years and this is far and away the best point and shoot I have ever owned. I'm not a professional photographer, but I know beautiful,clear,crisp pictures when I see them. This is a stylish, easy-to-use camera that really delivers. Congratulations to Kodak on such an outstanding camera!

Reviews.Title: Great Camera LOW Price
Reviews.Author: D. Myszka
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera to replace a broken nikon 5400,  that was a tank and took great photos but it was not as thin as this camera or as easy to use. This camera has a fairly quick start up, when it is not powered up it easily fits into a shirt or paints pocket.  I had heard that it did not have good build quality but they were seriously wrong with that remark.  to me the fit and finish on the kodak are as good if not better than thy were on my old nikon.  I love the ease of use and the quality photo's it has produced so far.  The price of the camera is a nobrainer if you can find a refurbuished one like mine and buy the camera for 1/2 the list price

Reviews.Title: Jimmy's Christmas camera
Reviews.Author: James E. Tingle
Reviews.Content: I really don't have a great deal of experience yet with this camera, but so far so good. I really like the looks and feel of it. Picture quality seems to be good , but I have used the 10X zoom very little, so not much input on that. Likewise on taking videos. I like the 3" LCD screen and the ease of operation. It has the main features I was looking for: 3" screen, 10X zoom, Li-Ion battery, and still pretty much pocket size. Will probably review again after more use with it.

Reviews.Title: Family and banquet
Reviews.Author: FatAlKing
Reviews.Content: This is not one of those expansive with 2 second fast power on.  It takes around 8 seconds to power up with a class 6 Transcend 16GB SDHC.  The video/picture processing time is around 4 seconds.  Of course I am talking around 9M or 12M pictures.  It's typical value among cameras.  If you can live with that, this is a wonderful camera for the price.  I purchased a refurnished one from a new company named Otter Creek Trading for $108+5 shippping.  I received it in 5 days counting Saturday and Sunday.The pictures are simply wonderful with good light source.  Of course, what the heck do you expect when light source is inadequate.  Never use terms like Noise to make one sound like an expert.  I used it on a wedding banquet with few lighting sources, videos all turned out fine.  Of course, if you really love your wedding, hire a professional video photographer.The sound is awfully week in camera.  It's perfect and clear when played on computer.  I love the date/time stamp feature in all pixel modes.  This is the only reason that I avoided Canon for the first time.The complains, it does not include any tv or hdmi outputs.  The display claims 200K+, but I can see minimum wavy line there.Sorry, date stamp only in all mepa-pixel, and no time stamp10/27, The photo and the photo with zoom are speechless.  However, i like to comment on the hd video.  the camera tries to follow the histogram (my guessing) and optimize the video quality accordingly.  It's a very nice 'camcorder' when lighting in the surrounding is even.  Except, when taking video by window side with bright light inside a somewhat dim restaurant, all people sit next to the window will have their face pretty much white out.  Be careful!11/5 use camera to format class 6.  it's super quick in bringing now.  before that, i used xp to format.The hd video in setting such as inside ChuckECheese is acceptable when view it without any conversion.

Reviews.Title: Great alternative to SLR!
Reviews.Author: John P. Roberts
Reviews.Content: I was looking for a new digital camera to use in place of my larger SLR.  My budget was very small so at first I felt my options were limited.  I have been into photography for about ten years I have a lot of experience with 35mm SLRs and not so much with digitals. I was nervous at first to buy this camera because I was not sure if the quality would be there, with it being such a low price and honestly was not sure how I felt about the Kodak brand.  All of my apprehensions were completely unfounded.  This is a GREAT camera!!  The manual settings are a nice feature allowing me the creative control I am used to.  The lens is very capable and it takes really good pictures.  The battery is a pretty high capacity for being factory, it takes a ton of photos before needing a recharge.  Also it is quite sturdy being somewhat larger than other digital point and shoots.  All of the cameras program settings are great too, which makes it really easy to just take snapshots and always takes good pictures inside in lower light and artificial light.  There is only one complaint which is really negligible, sometimes the camera runs slow when reviewing the pictures on the memory card or if I am taking alot of pictures very quickly.  Overall it is a non-issue.  This is a great camera for anyone and I highly recommend it to anyone who likes to take excellent photos on a budget.

Reviews.Title: Great starter camera
Reviews.Author: T. Stuart "2bdefacto"
Reviews.Content: The Kodak Z950 I highly recommend for the novice , beginner or someone looking for an excellent point and shoot. It has many features of high end Digital SLR's  without the cost. I have experimented with this camera and the Z950 has a very large amount of settings and options. From adjusting the aperture, to depth of field, sensor adjustments, speed adjustments several flash modes and under scene or "scn" on camera lets you choose the setting on what type of picture your taking, like close up flower, sunset/sunrise, light behind subject, long distance night shot, there are 17 settings for this alone, then the camera selects the best settings for subject. The camera is solid, well made, has rubber side grip, portable to slip into your pocket but not too tiny where it is difficult to hold  or easy to drop like some of those credit card sized cameras. I only wished that the lens was a bit bigger for wide angle shots. I did months of research on point and shoots and looked at several models: this Kodak was just what I was looking for.

Reviews.Title: Great Camera, incredible value!
Reviews.Author: THE TRUTH IS OUT THERE
Reviews.Content: I don't usually write reviews, but I feel the need to for this camera.  We were looking to find an affordable replacement for an older 3MP camera.  This camera was just what we needed.It is the most user friendly and intuitive camera I have ever used.  It takes great pictures and pretty good video for a digicam.  I did alot of research before buying and for $109.95 I feel that I got a great deal.  Don't pay more than you have to. This camera is as good as Canons and Panasonics that sell for $50-$120 more than what you'll pay for this one.

Reviews.Title: Great backup for my Nikon D700
Reviews.Author: John Barone
Reviews.Content: I am an amateur photographer with a Nikon D700 with battery grip and external flash.  Quite a pain to take everywhere I want to go.  That's where this Kodak comes in to play.  I have had it about six months now, and while it can not match the D700, I have to say it comes in at an acceptable 85%.  If it comes down to the fact that you don't want to drag the "real" camera with you, taking this is the next best thing.Thank you Kodak - Job very well done!John

Reviews.Title: Very easy to use!
Reviews.Author: Carly
Reviews.Content: The Kodak Z950 is a very nice camera.Easy to use, takes great pictures!  Nice zoom!I love good pictures but didn't want a complicated camera to work with.This is the one!

Reviews.Title: Kodak Z950
Reviews.Author: Darren
Reviews.Content: I've had a number of Kodak cameras before and all have performed very well over the years. After reading positive reviews all over the net for the Z950, I bought this camera for a trip to France w/ my 10 year old son. It has amazing features for such an inexpensive camera (comparatively) and even though I took 1000+ pics in a week, I barely scratched the surface on what this camera can do. The optical zoom and low light photo setting are outstanding, and the video quality is impressive. I missed having an 'eye' view finder but the LCD is large and the brightness settings offset even a sunny day. It also feels heavy / sturdy, and has great build quality. I felt that if I dropped it accidentally, I would be able to pick it up, dust it off, and start firing away again with no worries. Luckily, that never happened.If I had any complaint, it would be battery life. I expected the lithium battery that came w/ the camera to be good for hundreds of pics per day. That might be the case for daytime only, and no flash. However, if you do use flash or video for any appreciable amount of time (depends on the SD card size) expect the battery to drain quickly. If I take another trip like this one, I'll purchase a back-up battery.

Reviews.Title: John's Z950 Review
Reviews.Author: John Edward Larson
Reviews.Content: Although I have not yet used many of the camera's features, the one's I have used were relatively easy to learn and they perform well. For some reason, a few of the pictures taken without flash did not automatically focus well. I have to admit that I really miss having an optical viewfinder as the LED viewfinder is sometimes hard to see in the sun and it is difficult to snap rapidly moving objects using the LED viewfinder. The quality of the in-focus pictures is excellent and they can be blown up a great deal without losing resolution. I am a little disappointed in the battery as in that it is quite small and doesn't last long between charges.

Reviews.Title: kodak
Reviews.Author: Vince D. Fink "Vince"
Reviews.Content: first kodak and i am very pleased with it.  I wish there was like a lip around the screen though to protect it if you set it down for a second and didnt want it to get sratched.

Reviews.Title: Check out the picture size before you buy.
Reviews.Author: JerseyJim
Reviews.Content: I prefer to read user reviews rather than rely on reviews by the experts. This time I probably should have done both. I was replacing an older Kodak with what I thought was a higher resolution newer model. Unfortunately I simply looked at the mega pixels and didn't pay attention to how they do the math. Unfortunately, 12 MP means 4000 x 3000 or a 3 to 4 aspect ratio. Considering that the typical print these days is 4 x 6, you can readily see that pictures will have to be cropped. You can get to 4 x 6 but only by changing the settings and reducing the resolution. I know that reducing the resolution doesn't seem like a big deal. But I prefer to take pictures at full resolution and then decide how I wish to print them later on.I just received the camera. It was a great deal on Amazon. I ordered it on a Wednesday and had the camera by Friday even with normal shipping. So I started fooling around with it Saturday morning. I discovered the aspect ratio after downloading the test photos to IPhoto. As I tried to crop the photos, I noticed how severely a 2 x 3 crop was impacting my photos. It was only then that I noticed that the photos looked almost square.I believe that this will still turn out to be a reasonably good camera for the money once I get used to this. But I wanted to post something so that other folks considering this camera get a chance to investigate this before making a choice.

Reviews.Title: Fabulous Pictures, Slow Flash
Reviews.Author: Barbara Lamorticella
Reviews.Content: I used this camera for a month and a half and returned it to Costco.  This camera takes absolutely wonderful pictures-- crystal clear,  with beautiful, vibrant  colors.  It has a big zoom and it is packed full of features:  Burst, sports, panorama, high speed, macro, and 15 different other modes.  But it has one flaw which in the end made me  return it.  Most of the pictures I take are inside and need a flash.  This camera has a long delay (something like 2 seconds!)  between flashes the first three times-- then a much longer delay (something like 6 or 7 seconds) to get it ready for the next round of three flashes.  I'm a slow photographer under the best of circumstances. As much as I loved it, as much as I wanted to make it work,  I had to return it.  But if  you want to take outdoor pictures or well-lit indoor pictures without a flash, or if you take indoor shots of interiors, objects-- anything that won't start looking grim-faced after standing around posing for a long time! --  definitely buy this camera.  It takes pictures better than many cameras that cost three times as much.  At the current price,  $115,  it's a complete steal.One more drawback--  there is no printed manual,  only an electronic manual to load on your computer.  The camera does have a sort of built-in encyclopedia so you can get a lot of info right on the camera.  But, feature-packed as it is, it takes a while to learn the controls, and they aren't intuitive.  In my opinion it is very short-sighted for camera manufacturers to not include a printed manual.If I could I would give the camera a 5+ for quality of photos,  a  5 for features,  a 1 for flash speed,  and a 2 for the inconvenience of no printed manual.  That averages out to about 3, which I score it.

Reviews.Title: Use my mistake as your gain!  DON'T BUY!
Reviews.Author: tskangas
Reviews.Content: PROS:zoom option while taking videoCONS:wait time after taking picture  blurry photos  kind of a beast  primitive users manualWe've had this camera for about 18months. My husband bought it at OfficeMax b/c the saleslady recommended it. Did Kodak pay them to do that? I would not recommend this camera! I like to buy on Amazon so I can read reviews but my husband likes to shop in stores.First con: Waiting time between pictures. It will say "processing" for about 5-10 sec after taking pics (I've tried several modes, it doesn't do this every time but often enough to exasperate me). My hubby says "read the manual" but the manual is very basic- not really any tips- just explanation of camera features. There is a face detection feature that I make sure is off cuz that seems to slow it down. I've missed many good photo ops of the kids while waiting for this thing.Second con: Blurry photos. The pictures do not turn out sharp & clear! I'm not a photography expert. I just want good pics of my kids. I wanted a camera I can grab, turn on "Auto" & snap a good, clear photo. I've used cameras like that in the past but NOT this camera. In this time of technology it shouldn't be too much to ask but with this beast, it is. Please save yourself the headache I get while using this camera & buy a different brand.I'm sure I'd get good pics out of this camera if I knew better how to use it. I plan to look for some better instructions online sometime. Some of the pics posted by other reviewers look great. But if you are looking for an easy, point-and-shoot-w/o-having-to-think-about-settings camera, please buy a different one.PS My sis-in-law ended up buying the same camera- at OfficeMax- b/c the salesperson recommended it!

Reviews.Title: Kodak Z950
Reviews.Author: Laurie
Reviews.Content: Wish I could post some of the pics I've captured with this camera. Just took it out of the box and started shooting. The color is amazing and closeup are really great. This is the first camera in years I've been really happy with.

Reviews.Title: Slick piece of equipment for under $150
Reviews.Author: Carlton T. Barzon
Reviews.Content: I'm not a camera aficionado, but I've always liked Kodak products and this one hasn't disappointed. It's got a slick aesthetic and takes the sort of crisp photos I'd expect for a camera just under the $150 mark. Slight longer lag between pictures than I'd like, but no complaints otherwise.

Reviews.Title: My camera
Reviews.Author: NoPenName
Reviews.Content: The camera arrived in good condition, ready to operate after the battery was connected.  The instruction manual was skimpy, leaving some questions unanswered.The camera itself works well.  Since it is a 12 mp camera, the resulting images can be cropped and manipulated without significantly degrading the image.  It would be nice if the camera had a viewfinder.  I find it difficult to precisely frame a picture.I would buy it again.

Reviews.Title: Satisfied customer
Reviews.Author: Glen Hays
Reviews.Content: I didn't want a camera that was too complicated to operate.  I read lots of camera reviews and kept coming back to the Z950. I also liked the sale price. I asked advice from some family members that knew more about cameras and they thought this would be perfect for me.  It is easy to operate and I like using the zoom. My old camera is Kodak Easy Share CX7300. I am giving it to my daughter. She can learn on it like I did and then upgrade someday.

Reviews.Title: Christmas Present
Reviews.Author: Melissa Oliver "ArmyChick"
Reviews.Content: I purchased this camera as a Christmas present for my mother. She is very impressed with the quality of the pictures. She stood on the front porch of her house and took a picture a house down the street and was able to zoom in and actually read the license plate number.

Reviews.Title: Kodak EasyShare Camera
Reviews.Author: Meredith M. Bittner "MMB"
Reviews.Content: This camera was bought as a present. It has been a joy to the family who received it! It was new and came with everything that was stated. You need to buy a larger memory card but that is all.

Reviews.Title: from one Kodak to the next
Reviews.Author: M. Ramirez "VWMeggs"
Reviews.Content: I have had many different models over the years, but always stuck with the "easy to use" Kodak brand.The V1233 I had fell off the table & the telescoping lens bent, horribly. I needed a good camera in a pinch. I waited 5 days before buying this one after much research. I am very happy with this camera!It's a little bigger than the V1233, but not as big as some of the older models I've owned. It's zoom is second to none. Perfect quality in even the worst lighting conditions. Some how it captures my crazy kids looking still even when they are in motion, no blur.I love it & depending on your needs would likely reccommend it.

Reviews.Title: High price for bad pictures
Reviews.Author: Mama Unicorn "Ruby"
Reviews.Content: I'm the first to admit I'm a photography dunce.  I have no idea what the differences between ISO, aperture, and shutter speed are. (I plan to ask The Internet sometime.)  I do know that I like my cameras to take good pictures quickly, and this one just didn't cut it.  I say "didn't" because after 15 months of use, it has fritzed out and randomly chooses which setting it will be in.  So while it still takes pictures, a flash on Sports setting produces awful pictures of children around the house.Pros:*In-camera charging: I love that I can plug the USB cord in to my car charger.*A variety of settings: Lots to choose from, especially the scene setting.  However, I ended up using the Portrait setting most of the time because I didn't like how pictures in the other settings turned out.*It's durable: this thing has seen it's share of drops. . . although obviously it took its toll.*The screen is strong.Cons:*I don't like the picture quality.*Colors never come out right, and the pictures are often grainy or over saturated.*I hate the flash-- it doesn't flatter.*LOOOONG Processing time between takes, especially when switching to and from Video.  We're talking 10-15 seconds.*Doesn't work well in low-light conditions.I don't think I'll buy a Kodak camera anymore.  I'm trying to decide between a Fuji and a Canon.Update:  I strongly recommend the Canon 230HS. After using that, I only now realize how bad this Kodak has been at taking pictures. . . it just doesn't take nice pictures of people. I've had my Canon for a month, and it's the best camera I've ever owned.

Reviews.Title: Great picture quality but breaks easy
