Reviews.Author: quitosky
Reviews.Content: The camera shop just called to pick up my Kodak Z950 that broke lastweek. I had this camera for a year and takes great pictures. Like other reviews and comment from CNET review, sometimes it takes time for camera to process a shot before you can take another pic. The 720HD video option is not so great. A lot of noise on the video. There are times when i turn on the camera, i would get an error message that SD card is not recognized. So i would do the "off and on" bottom to fix.  Went to the beach two weeks ago and after taking a few pics, sand got in the lens. First the lens cover wont close and later the camera just stopped working. Took it to the shop and paid almost $90 to fix. I'll buy a case to protect but if it breaks again, will just trash buy the Canon S95 which is the mini-version of a DSLR.

Reviews.Title: Great Camera...until it broke.
Reviews.Author: Brian T. Gleason "Moose"
Reviews.Content: My wife and I thoroughly enjoyed our z950 for the past year and a half. The High ISO feature made pictures indoors a breeze and we got many great pictures of our very active kids. Unfortunately it is a paperweight now because it will no longer accept the memory card (won't stay in). Too bad, we really enjoyed it until then.

Reviews.Title: Excellent Quality Pictures...but kind of slow
Reviews.Author: R. Browne
Reviews.Content: I've had this camera for almost a year now and I'm very impressed. The photos are extremely clear and vivid. Even when taken in the night the photos look like if it were daytime. The video quality is superb, at 720p HD!!! I've watched videos back on my PC from this camera and it felt like I was reliving the experience. The only downside to shooting in 720p mode is the size of the video. I've had 1min vids at +100MB! Yes, this camera is a bit on the heavy side but it's performance far makes up for this. It's also designed for easy one hand shooting. The zoom is great also...though it doesn't seem to go as far as I originally thought it would. My main complaint about this camera is it's processor which seems to slow down after taking about 15-25 photos in succession. The 'processing' messages pop up after every photo during this time and I've waited for it to go away at max 15-20 seconds!!! Nevertheless, this is an excellent camera and I would recommend it to anyone who wants excellent quality photos at a good price. You might want to get it somewhere other than amazon though...I see the price has more than doubled since my last purchase...

Reviews.Title: I was just waiting for low-cost point-&-shoot digital cameras to get faster sensors so that I could shoot at night.
Reviews.Author: R. Scott "macfanboy"
Reviews.Content: Metamora, Indiana was always an inspiring place to photograph. I was just waiting for low-cost point-&-shoot digital cameras to get faster sensors so that I could shoot at night. Last Spring, I bought a Refurbished Kodak Easyshare z950 for $115. It has an ISO speed of 3200 which is a big jump from my previous camera that had an ISO of 400.  It does nice night photography.

Reviews.Title: Brilliant for the price
Reviews.Author: Rajeev Motha "Rajeev M"
Reviews.Content: This cam is Brilliant for the price you pay for it. (Especially as I was lucky enough to get it for 125$ a few months back on Amazon)I guess everyone has covered how awesome the pic quality and everything is so i'll skip to some of the minor issues I encountered with it.1) I bought an 8GB 15Mb/s HCSD card for this. It supports, but after taking a few thousand pics (maybe 4GB or so) the cam startup time tends to slow down dramatically. - however this is not a problem if your not that trigger happy and going on shorter vacations ;)2) Dont expect much form Video. It's almost unusable in low light conditions, and has trouble keeping focus in even average lighting. Also, sometimes switching to video mode from any other mode takes ages (15-30s!) and that's really annoying.3) Recently i came across this issue, it suddenly switches off and doesn't come back on. But a quick re-insertion of the battery sorts it out.

Reviews.Title: my camera
Reviews.Author: Forestry Major
Reviews.Content: i looked at cameras for a year before getting this one its really a good camera a mid ranged camera for a good price has a nice compromise between zoom capability's and size. I love the fact that you can get a picture of a bird or plane up closer then you can see it with your eye. it would be a good camera for someone like me who wants to take nice photos and do some birding and not spend a ton.

Reviews.Title: Really disappointed
Reviews.Author: Jennifer "mom of 2 girls"
Reviews.Content: I have had a few Kodak cameras and loved them. They are intuitive to use and great cameras. This one started acting weird right away. It was a gift and so a hassle to return.  I really should have made the effort because it went from freezing and sometimes getting a blank or striped screen to completely freezing with the lens out and open. I cannot get it to do anything. I am really bummed. Most of the pictures I got were pretty good. I did notice that in comparison with other Kodak cameras I have owned that the pics were more blurry and I had to take more time to let the camera really focus. It is not so great for action shots. Plus if I took more than 2 or 3 pics in a succession it would have to process and take sometimes a minute to be ready again. When you are chasing after your cute kids trying to get pics, this is not a positive. So now I am stuck trying to find another camera. . .

Reviews.Title: Very reliable camera just heed some advice...
Reviews.Author: Pat JP "Dorlis972"
Reviews.Content: Ill try to keep this short and sweet. Here are the pluses of the camera (+) great color reproduction (+) great resolution (+) smart capture mode has some neat features like HDR (+) easy and accessible manual modes (PASM) (+) Decent LCD (+) Great build quality - not too small not overly big (+) Image stabilization works charms -- no more blurry pics. (+) Great flash performance (+) Great panoramic mode (+) Great scenes modes(try the night portrait mode for some truly interesting pic outcomes at night). (+) very useful 10X zoom. (+) Price (shop around for the best price). (+) HD movies @ 720P (not the best quality but for the price... you'll be hard pressed to find similar).The minuses are as follows (-) Battery life isn't great - get a second battery (-) Ok Low light performance (without flash) (-) Not the fastest to process pics.Here are some recommendations for people that want the best out of their camera: Turn the camera off if you won't be shooting for 2-5 minutes (this saves batteries). The camera works while it is on analyzing the scene before you press the shutter button. Turn off continuous Image stabilization and instead press the shutter button halfway to activate Image stabilization. Read the manual to find this option. Buy an extra battery. Buy a class 4 or 6 SDHC card -- this will speeds the time taken to process pics significantly.In all I don't regret buying this camera, especially for the price I paid for it. All my family and coworkers have been impressed with it's features, and for my uses, it works very well. I just want good pictures, well exposed and clear and manual options. I get that with this camera. Highly recommended!

Reviews.Title: Great Camera for price!
Reviews.Author: Deployed Dave
Reviews.Content: Great Camera for price! !10 x zoom is awesome...though no digital zoom. Found that to prevent picture blur must always use camera in sport mode to ensure high shutterspeed. Definitely would buy again. Color and picture quality fantastic!

Reviews.Title: good camera---not for long
Reviews.Author: sweetmyrrh
Reviews.Content: I have this camera about 1 year and 2 weeks.  When I had it for 1 year and 2days, the optical zoom stopped working, and so did the flash.  Nothing bad ever happened to it, I never dropped it or misued it any way.  Naturally, because it was over 1 year, it was out of warranty, and Kodak wanted $110 to fix it.The camera itself was easy to use and it took great pictures, but who can afford to spend $200 for something which lasts a year....not me.  I've been researching for a new camera online, and now I feel paranoid about buying anybrand, but I think I'm going to go with a Panasonic lumix, as that is what I owned previously and had no trouble at all.  Here's hoping the new one works!The Z950 was not a bad camera, but because of this experience, I would never buy another product from Kodak.

Reviews.Title: Great camera
Reviews.Author: slwchew "slwchew"
Reviews.Content: I actually downgraded my camera to get this one because my more expensive fancy camera was too bulky.  I wanted one that was more portable but still had the quality glass lense.  This was it.  I love it.  Picture quality is great.  Just as good as my other camera.  To be fair, you should know that I only use Kodak cameras so that is the limit of my comparison.

Reviews.Title: Getting the Same thing...
Reviews.Author: Michael Jones
Reviews.Content: I had purchased a Kodak camera a few years back. I used it all the time. Recently, I was hiking and dropped it into a stream. I wanted to try and get the same exact camera, because I took excellent pictures with it and was very satisfied with it. I went onto the Kodak's webpage to try and find the exact model, only to find they didn't make it anymore. I spoke to a Kodak customer rep. to find out what would be a similar model with the same features, and same amount of megapixels. He shared with me that this would be the closest model. I then came to Amazon, typed in the same model, and found it to be 100 dollars CHEAPER, and it would only cost me about 30 more dollars for a 3 year warrantee. This was a no brainer. I got the camera recently, and so far, it's almost the same thing that I had before with a few new features. It take great pictures, it came with a handy wrist attachment, a chord to charge the battery, and all the same things that would have come with it, were I to order from Kodak's webpage.

Reviews.Title: Ok, but very blurry corners (2) at wide angle and  can be slow
Reviews.Author: Will
Reviews.Content: This camera has a lot of nice features, but is let down by image quality problems, both the ones I got had VERY blurry corners on either the left or right side, going pretty far into the frame when shooting at full wide-angle (it wasn't a problem once you "zoomed" some).  I realize the center will tend to be sharper than the edges or corners, but not this bad, besides what about the other side of the frame with only slightly blurry corners?  It probably wouldn't be noticeable in a 4x6 print.  The camera is also quite slow once it's image buffer is filled up.  If you should take three shots in quick succession, the camera won't let you take another photo for eight seconds after that.  If you're using the burst mode (which takes three quick shots), you won't be able to take another burst for....24 seconds.  The camera displays a "processing" message when you do.  This was when flash was set to off, so it wasn't waiting while it recharged the flash.  Depending on the type of shooting you do, this may or may not be an issue for you.The aperture and shutter priority are nice features that many travel zoom cameras such as this lack. I couldn't get the manual focus to work because the display didn't provide enough detail to accurately focus that way.  The autofocus was fine. Amazon was nice enough to first send me a replacement camera and then to take that back too (same problem, but on the right side of the frame instead of the left).  Be sure to read other reviews (user & professional) too, my experience may be the exception.

Reviews.Title: kodak z950 camera
Reviews.Author: kiwi
Reviews.Content: this is the first Kodak digital camera I have purchased in about 9 years.  I did not like the earlier digital models - too flimsy and cheap looking, plus, requiring 4 double A batteries (not a good thing at a sports venue juggling 8 batteries without dropping any).  the Z950 has the heft and looks of a more expensive point and shoot, and the sports setting works great.  this camera is a compliment to my other cameras, both nikons, and each has a purpose.  Thank you, Amazon.com.

Reviews.Title: Good Camera but issue with Image Stablization
Reviews.Author: Ajeet
Reviews.Content: I have been using it for one month now.I bought it in just 120$. Very happy till now....except one thing....actually two things........1.) If you take picture of moving objects...like on road...or in hotel...or in crowd...it doesn't take sharp picture.....very blur...I tried all different settings, but didn't help. So I believe, its image stablization is not so good.2.) Slow processing...if you take 3-4 picture continuously...and it will take 4-5 mins for processing.....well it might be my memory card issue. not sure on it.That's any I am giving it 4 star.but apart from these two points.....it will beat any other camera....happy with it :)

Reviews.Title: Very Good Low End Camera
Reviews.Author: Zephead
Reviews.Content: I purchased this camera mainly for the 10X zoom.  I took a trip to the Phila. Zoo and a Phillies game and was very impressed with the camera.  My seats where in right field for the Phillies game and I was able to get great pictures of the batter.  Everybody sitting behind me commented on how good the pictures were coming out.  Many of them thought I paid $400-$500 for the camera.  I think some of them will be buying it when the go home.  This isn't the greatest camera ever made but for the price, it's perfect for what I wanted to use it for.Pros:Great Price10x ZoomCons:Battery, would have preferred regular batteries.USB Cord, not the normal mini-USB that I have 10 cables of (e.g. Cell Phone, PS3 controller cable)I would recommend this camera to my friend.

Reviews.Title: KODAK Z950 EASY SHARE CAMERA
Reviews.Author: C Wilson
Reviews.Content: I ALREADY HAD A GREAT KODAK EASY SHARE CAMERA WITH 3X OPTICAL ZOOM BUT WANTED A KODAK WITH MORE OPTICAL ZOOM.  I CHOSE THIS ONE BECAUSE OF THE 10X AND BECAUSE IT WAS A KODAK EASY SHARE.  I LIKE THE ZOOM CAPABILITY.  I MISS A COUPLE OF MODES WHEN YOU ARE IN SCENE THAT I HAD WITH MY OTHER CAMERA BUT I AM LEARNING TO ADJUST.  IT'S NICE AND SLIM AND I LIKE NOT HAVING TO TAKE OFF THE LENS COVER.  WHEN THE CAMERA IS OFF IT FOLDS BACK INSIDE ITSELF.  I MISS A VIEW FINDER BECAUSE IT HELPED IN STEADING THE CAMERA AND WHEN TAKING PICS IN BRIGHT LIGHT.  SINCE YOU HAVE TO LOOK AT THE SCREEN TO SEE YOUR PICTURE, I ORDERED AND ATTACHED A DELKIN POP-UP SHADE.  THIS MAKES ALL THE DIFFERENCE AND CUTS THE GLARE GIVING YOU GREAT EASE FOR OUTDOOR PICTURE TAKING.

Reviews.Title: Great camera at a great price
Reviews.Author: James W. Ely
Reviews.Content: I have a Kodak 5 mega pixel Z740 which is a good camera, but the new Kodak Z950 is better in the respect that it is more of a point and shoot type with alot more features. Not as cumbersome to carry, with the same 10x optical zoom and 12 mega pixels, the rechargable battery is a plus. I like his camera very much. Great pictures at an affordable price. I would recomend is camera to  anyone! Sincerely James Ely

Reviews.Title: z950 - Definitely not your typical Kodak...
Reviews.Author: Anonymous
Reviews.Content: Definitely not your typical Kodak... easily 4.5 Stars out of 5At $140, including delivery from Amazon, a fantastic bargain in a compact tele-zoom camera. With 12.1MP and 10x Optical zoom lens you get an effective 35mm-350mm focal range performance.  Real solid build quality - only thing missing and found on the higher-end priced competition is a true "wide-angle" lens.  Kodak should also consider upgrading to a higher quality resolution LCD for the live-view, especially noticeable in bright lights or direct sunlight since there's no view finder alternative.  No need to worry or compensate for exposure or image quality - take the pix - trust it, you'll not be disappointed by the result.Takeaways:- ergonomics are good but somewhat bulky; however given the optics and capable P-A-S-M feature sets included (i.e. Program, Aperture priority, Shutter priority, and Manual shooting modes) makes this compact tele-zoom a terrific bargain and value- especially liked the molded handgrip feature and material used in construction which aid in ease of use and feel- camera showed very good resolution and detail in both still and HD 720p video, though in poor lighting the AF tended to be somewhat hesitant to respond- battery life is good but Kodak should have included some type of SDHD card in the packaging since you need to purchase it separately and the internal memory quickly fills up with only a few pixs takenIf you can live without the wide-angle and somewhat bothersome display quality, there's nothing out there in the market at this price which offers all the features and performance as this camera. Period....

Reviews.Title: Easy Peasy Picture Taking
Reviews.Author: Katie "Katie"
Reviews.Content: I am not a professional photographer, but do love having a decent camera in the house.  Recently the children were playing on the slip and slide and this camera took terrific motion shots of them. There is nothing more precious than capturing a child in candid motion.  The shutter speed can vary - sometimes it seems to snap fast, others it hesitates.  Not sure if this is camera or operator issue.It is very easy to move from video to still and back again.  The video quality is very good. No grainy look so far. The sound is nearly inaudible on camera playback, but could be ok - will follow up once we upload.  Some features are a bit complicated to figure out - but I have downloaded the PDF manual to my laptop and just keep referring to it when I get stuck.The screen size is fab - and the quality of images so far is superb.  The zoom is okay at times and disappointing at others.  I used to own a great 35mm with a macro, so perhaps I am expecting too much.  Sometimes it zooms in real close with crystal clear quality - other times it can't seem to focus.  I like that the camera sound effects can be turned off.I purchased this on HSN - I think Kodak should have included a memory card.  I took 4 pics and the internal memory was full.  I spent $45 buying an 8gig Class 4 card.  The other somewhat disappointing thing is that we just invested in AA rechargeables and charger for our other camera - this comes with its own battery.  I will have to buy a second one to make sure we are covered for big events.All in all, I do like this camera and feel I made an excellent choice for the price point I had to play with.

Reviews.Title: great camera
Reviews.Author: L. Boyle
Reviews.Content: great camera! I have another Kodak camera and have always loved them. It takes great pictures and is very easy to use. It could turn on a little faster but that is the only downsize.

Reviews.Title: needs just a few more minor features to make it a no-brainer choice
Reviews.Author: RLSd
Reviews.Content: For a camera that offers PASM manual modes, it also needs manual focus for macro shooting, and pre-focusing on an area to capture fast action (like a skateboarder coming in and out of frame quickly). Also needed are custom white balance, variable JPG compression levels. and manual flash levels to optically trigger off-camera flashes. Kodak makes good value cameras, but it's these minor features that are lacking and come standard in competitors cameras that break the deal for me.

Reviews.Title: Kodak EasyShare Z950
Reviews.Author: Roger W. Whitehead Sr. "Groovy Dude"
Reviews.Content: I bought it, took pictures, and they look great. Easy to use, a great buy for the money.

Reviews.Title: Great value 10x zoom
Reviews.Author: Roger Halford
Reviews.Content: I am no expert and have only owned 2 digital cameras prior to this one. Up till now, the first one, a 3MP Kodak (bought in 2003 for more than double the curent purchase!) was the clear favourite for ease of use and results (particularly colours). I also liked the ability to resize to 3:2 since we commonly print only 6x4 for the album. So I started off a little biased towards Kodak. The new z950 represented a significant upgrade in MP and ability. It is a nice compromise between the usual point-and-shoot and the larger digital/slr types, because it has plenty of manual settings to play with, in addition to the range of scenes with their automatic settings. It is also small enough for large pockets/small handbags/purses, unlike the 20x zoom brigade. The 10x zoom is enough for my needs for sure. On regular Auto-no brain-point-and-shoot it is really quite clever in ascertaining the right setting. Like anything auto, you can catch it out occasionally, so it's not perfect, but I am impressed by how often it gets things right (such as dim background to bright foreground and vice versa). For the money ($140) it was a bargain compared to the regular point and shoots at the same price.

Reviews.Title: Great pictures, disappointing video
Reviews.Author: gimme a thinking nurse anyday "Dr. Sue"
Reviews.Content: I wish I had known that the videos created are in QuickTime or MP3 format. Not easily compatible with Windows Movie Maker.The videos also are quite grainy in low light.But still pictures are quite good and this is an amazingly easy camera to use, which makes this a great choice.

Reviews.Title: Great camera, great pictures, even in dark places
Reviews.Author: H. Pulliam
Reviews.Content: This is a great camera, good zoom, great pictures even in dark areas, easy to use.

Reviews.Title: Too Slow, OK Indoor Pictures
Reviews.Author: M. A. Blouin
Reviews.Content: I got this camera and after one day returned it. I shot over 100 pictures and a few video clips at a weeding. Like most cameras, the outdorr shots were pretty good. However, the indoor darker light pictures are not very good. The worst part about the camera is the speed. It was very very slow. The lag between pictures was one of the worst I had experienced, but not as worse as a Samsung I had a few years ago. I have had a Kodak camera in the past, infact my first digital camera was a Kodak and it was great. If you are looking for something that is much faster, then look elsewhere like the Panasonic ZS3 in this class.

Reviews.Title: I get good pictures
Reviews.Author: C. Hinton
Reviews.Content: The camera is now a few years old. I set the camera on 'auto' and take snapshots, which is what this type of camera was designed to do, and I get good pictures. If you want pro quality portraits you need to buy a pro camera and lenses.The only problem I have is the USB stopped working. I bought an inexpensive SD card reader to avoid replacing the camera.

Reviews.Title: Kodak EasyShare Z950 Camera
Reviews.Author: Marjorie West
Reviews.Content: This is my second Z950 and I love it, the pictures always come out great and it is easy to learn and use.

Reviews.Title: I am a professional photographer....
Reviews.Author: Elaine C Thomas
Reviews.Content: Coming from the old school, about to gain my first grandbaby and not wanting to turn to digital, I found myself searching for a small camera I could throw in my whatever bag I had on me that had the power and quality that I wanted without having to carry all the 'old' & heavy equipment I had.  I did a LOT of research & comparison shopping as I have 2 Nikons, 2 Canons and a Minolta.  Leaning towards the Nikon in this category, when I compared them and all the comments from both pros and lay people, this Kodak is the one that ultimately won my heart.I could shoot my baby while holding her close without struggling with a bulky camera and get great shots!  The quality isn't quite up there with the SLR's, but it is awesome for what it is and now that I have 2 more grandbabies, it has been put to the test!  I've taken it all over the world with me and I have to say, I'm glad to have this one with me while watching those around me struggle with the larger cameras!  A lot of them don't know how to use the larger SLR's properly and I've already got the shot before they're able to get their cameras ready!I'm looking at getting another one soon.....I might have to go with another one of these....we'll see!ElaineC

Reviews.Title: Miss it
Reviews.Author: Vincent S. Lum "SPHR"
Reviews.Content: The lens was fantastic and super sharp.  Unfortunately, the card reader was defective, so I returned the camera.  I truly miss the lens though.  I have a few photos which remind me of its quality.

Reviews.Title: I used this for years until I dropped mine and lost screen
Reviews.Author: Henry Bruens
Reviews.Content: This camera was compact and carried accessories on my belt.  I got the best pictures and easy to carry especially now with only my right hand working after accident with left arm.  I have extra batteries always with me.

Reviews.Title: Camera sent when requested
Reviews.Author: BJ Crooks
Reviews.Content: I had requested to get the camera earlier than what was submitted and I did get it early as requested.  It's a fine camera.

Reviews.Title: do not buy
Reviews.Author: Allen Nelson
Reviews.Content: didn't last very long maybe a year, then the zoom quit working, thus the camera quit. Worthless piece of ####

Reviews.Title: Disappointed
Reviews.Author: L. Edwards
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera a year or so ago.  I liked the pictures that it took.  However, the processor is extremly slow and it takes a long time between shots and would randomly freeze and I had to shut the camera off.  Just after the warranty ran out, it began to randomly stop reading various memory cards.  It is now useless because it will not read any memory card and the camera itself only holds 5 pictures.  I am very disappointed in Kodak as this is the 3rd camera (2 water cameras) that I have purchased that have stopped working within a year.  I will no longer buy from Kodak.

Reviews.Title: DON'T DO IT
Reviews.Author: Ro
Reviews.Content: This camera is a headache. It is so slow! Forget spontaneous shots. It takes forever to process. It is bulky for the performance that it gives. A cheap, slim snap and shoot provides the same quality. And to top it off- mine just stopped turning on! The worst camera that I have ever had. I took it into a repair shop and was told that it would cost $200 to fix. I was also told that people that know a lot about photography know not to buy Kodak cameras anymore. The camera shop that I went to wouldn't even carry them because they are so problematic. A HORRIBLE HORRIBLE BUY- DON'T DO IT! You will regret it. I sure do. I wish I had my money back- buying 100 disposable cameras would have been a better choice.

Reviews.Title: Nice
Reviews.Author: LRS
Reviews.Content: Replacing a stolen Kodak that I thought I loved.  Love this one even more.  Takes super pictures.

Reviews.Title: Better than expected
Reviews.Author: V. Ryan
Reviews.Content: Reading other reviews I had a good idea of what to expect, Thanks other reviewers!I was told after 3 pictures taken fast that it would take time to process next picture,exactly right, but not a issue for me. So many capabilities in a small package with good software, and customer supportmake this a great buy. To the speeders: Use a class 4 or 6 memory card

Reviews.Title: Takes GREAT outdoor daylight pictures inside pictures not so much
Reviews.Author: Nikki
Reviews.Content: Like I said great outdoor pictures in the daylight not so much at night they all come out really dark. & inside most come our too dark when the flash doesn't flash, & when it does the picture is all white from the flash and every couple pictures comes out fine sometimes, it's really frustrating

Reviews.Title: Worth the money, but could be better.
Reviews.Author: Peter R. Grimaldi "barefooter"
Reviews.Content: This camera is worth the money, but could be better in consrtuction. The battery door is flimsy an comes open easily. The usb connection cover is attached by a little rubber tang and is difficult to open, you have to be careful not to pull it off the camera. The screen is hard to see in daylight, so forget about manual focus in bright light. The pictures I have taken so far are GREAT looking on the computer monitor or HDTV. I have a KODAK ESP 3250 printer and my prints are VERY GOOD. I love that it can record 2 SD video & 1 HD video resolutions.It is really worth the cost, despite it's problems.

Reviews.Title: Great pictures and easy to use. Sound on camera barely audible.
Reviews.Author: joyceomaha
Reviews.Content: I love the camera overall, but sound is too low on video playback. Photos are sharp and has good telephoto lens.  Much easier to use than the Kodak M580, which I returned because the buttons were too small and awkward to use.  The size of the Z950 is easy to put in purse, but the buttons are still large enough to manipulate.

Reviews.Title: Nice Camera
Reviews.Author: C. Ison "Lady C"
Reviews.Content: I received the camera but have not used it enough to give a fair review.  I do wish that it had a better and more detailed how to use booklet. It does have built-in help instructions but I am more comfortable with hands on info. I do like the feel and construction.  I am not a regular camera user except for when traveling, attending family functions and etc,  but I do like to keep a good one in my possession.

Reviews.Title: Thrilled but Disappointed
Reviews.Author: Suresh Krishna "EclipseGuru"
Reviews.Content: I was thrilled by the fact that this has the 10x zoom with 35-350 mm. For the price, the features it offers is great!However, when i received the piece, this turns out to be a real crap. I clicked exactly 5 pictures in 10 minutes of time and the LCD becomes completely bright and turns white. After that i cant do anything, need to restart by taking out the battery.I definitley dont want to have headache with this system and i returned it the same day.I later took the Canon PowerShot SD1300IS 12.1 MP Digital Camera with 4x Wide Angle Optical Image Stabilized Zoom and 2.7-Inch LCD (Blue) which is much smaller and nicer than this piece. Yes, it does not have 10x zoomm... but who cares... it works as expected.

Reviews.Title: Chokes on SD Cards
Reviews.Author: Roger John Corrin
Reviews.Content: The Z950 takes great pictures when it works.  I purchased this camera on May 4th (Amazon free shipping took almost two weeks).  Also purchased an Adata Class 6 8gb SD Card from a different retailer.  Camera worked fine until about June 15th.  On power-up, it displayed a message that the "Memory Card is unusable (Please insert a new card)".  The card will read/write perfectly under Windows XP.  Reformatted the card under XP and received same message.  Kodak's tip to reset the camera, pull the battery, and try it again didn't work either.  Tried a second 2gb card.  Camera insists that it needs to reformat it (this time with the camera reformat).  Camera sporadically requires that this card be reformatted.  Currently using a 1 gb card - hopefully the camera won't corrupt/reject this one too.  Also, Amazon dropped the price by $32 30 days after I purchased this camera.

Reviews.Title: Waste Of Money
Reviews.Author: Sol David Rodriguez
Reviews.Content: This camera died after few days of used. The features are great but the overall product build and quality are very poor.PROS:10x ZoomImage QualityUser FriendlyEasy To OperateCONS:ControlsPoor Build QualityCheapA lot of Noises

Reviews.Title: Kodak Easyshare Z950
Reviews.Author: M. Therese Curtin
Reviews.Content: There was no view finder available for those very bright sunny days.  I found the camera was bulky and the plasticconstruction were no comparison to the Canon Power Shot I already own.  The buttons next to the LCD added no value to me.The user manual is not user friendly and online extended manual was just as bad.  I found myself calling Kodak toanswer my questions.  Good price from Amazon, but I would suggest paying more for a Canon product.

Reviews.Title: Nothing but problems
Reviews.Author: Mikael Schonberg
Reviews.Content: I've had this camera for a few months, and have had nothing but problems with it.Every time I upload pictures onto my computer, the process is different, or just doesn't work at all.The camera also freezes quite frequently.I am currently trying to figure out how to get the camera, which is stuck in the on mode, but with a black screen and lens extended, to just turn off! It's also fully charged...Also, the battery life is extremely short, and the online guide is terrible and pretty much useless.

Reviews.Title: Snap Shoot
Reviews.Author: Robert E. Griffith
Reviews.Content: Camera is all I expected, But have not mastered transfering to my pictures on my computer yet.

Reviews.Title: cheap?
Reviews.Author: Jeff Clymer
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera and had it for a week. I set it on the arm of my couch, which it fell off of. It landed on thick carpet. The camera never funcitoned again. Very fragile. Look for something tougher.

Reviews.Title: Solid Camera, Lots of Features, Competitive Price
Reviews.Author: Phillip
Reviews.Content: So far so good.  I like the smaller size and the long zoom.  Great price on Amazon.  Looking forward to taking a lot of pictures with this camera.

Reviews.Title: Worked great (for 2 days)
Reviews.Author: Jerry R. South "Photo fan"
Reviews.Content: I had the camera for two days then it stopped working. The seller was very good and refunded my money quickly. I have had a panasonic camera for over two years and a nikon for over four that both stilll work fine. This may have been a fluke but I will stick to panasonic and nikons in the future

Reviews.Title: does not work
Reviews.Author: Candy
Reviews.Content: the camera I bought does not work.  I need to know where I can sent it back for a replacement or money backPlease answer this E Mail,  Candace

Reviews.Title: What the Heck?!
Reviews.Author: MR.V
Reviews.Content: The Kodak Z950 that I received in the mail looked used and old from the look of the original kodak box case. The product looked like it was used before with creases on the plastic bags (New Products should not have regular scotch tape on the original box case) that had the camera in it. I also found this problem with the other bags that contained the charger that comes with the camera and the bag for the USB charging chords. This product was not what I expected. Overall experience with this camera sucked. Do not by this product!!

Reviews.Title: Smaller than I expected
Reviews.Author: M. Reid
Reviews.Content: This camera takes wonderful pictures, the only thing I have problem withis the focus when taking video, maybe it's me but it does not stabilizeor the focus is not fixed.I love it anyway.

Reviews.Title: Not so good Video quality
Reviews.Author: P. Hood "dannoone"
Reviews.Content: I bought this for the supposedly HD 720P video resolution that it was suppose to have.  I had just bought a 47" LCD TV and was anxious to try it out on it.  It was a big let down for the price that I paid for it.  The video was grainy.  It was not even good to call it standard 480P resolution.  This was really a big let down as this was the main reason that I purchased this model.  The YouTube video advertisements look good and had a influence in my decision to go this model from Kodak.  Now I will probably never buy a product from Kodak again because of this.

Reviews.Title: this camera is the worst kodak out there
Reviews.Author: Mar "Marinera"
Reviews.Content: im a kodak fan and had lots of kodaks and this one is really bad.bad qualityalways out of focus. i very dissapointed on this camera also its very expensive for a kodak.i return and got the fuji f70 much nicer than this one.

ProductInfo.Features:
12-megapixel resolution
10x optical zoom
Smart Capture feature automatically identifies the scene and adjusts camera settings
3-inch LCD screen
Capture images to SD/SDHC memory cards (not included)
ProductInfo.Name: Kodak EasyShare Z950 12 MP Digital Camera (Black) with 10x Optical Image Stabilized Zoom and 3.0-Inch LCD
